content.raw:
I'm not a big fan of forcing stuff int `/usr` - this has a _really_ bad smell to it, as it can collide with user bits, and if a user somehow loses their install manifest from CMake, then they might have to struggle with removing old bits.

I’d suggest \(in order of my personal preference\):

* `~/.local/opt/sdformat/{version}` - easier to remove, layer in. I like doing this for things like buliding `python` from source with different variants \(e.g. `2.7.12-dbg-valgrind`\). Even if `sdformat` has its own nested versions, it’s still nice to limit its scope.
* `~/.local` - but could collide with other installs \(e.g. `pip`\) if things get scrappy
* `/opt/sdformat` - better, but still a wee bit sketchy
* `/opt` - acceptable, but please don’t…
* `/usr/local` - acceptable, but please don’t…
* `/usr` - please dont'!!!

I use scripts like this on my system to control when I layer this stuff in \(more or less inspired by catkin devel spaces\):

[https://gist.github.com/EricCousineau-TRI/ce79d3265bb72934267e24ddc8c623bc#file-cpython\_dbg\_valgrind-sh-L47-L62](https://gist.github.com/EricCousineau-TRI/ce79d3265bb72934267e24ddc8c623bc#file-cpython_dbg_valgrind-sh-L47-L62) \(these are my recipes for Python valgrind shindigs\)
